title: How are science and society connected through technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Science and technology is the best thing society would ever request. Since the modern transformation in the eighteenth century science has been in advancement. A few segments that have been helped by science and technology are energy, physical sciences, information and communication. The society has significantly picked up with the development of technology. Foundation in the society has developed with the assistance of science and technology. Methods of transport like electronic railroad lines were acknowledged and these really profited the society by offering them a superior method for transport. Before, just about everything was simple however because of the science and technology we are currently being digitalized by the day. The development of the phone and radio administrations has expanded human communication.

Technology is, essentially, an application of scientific principles towards some opportunity, common good, or capability that society finds valuable. “Value”, in this case, can be expressed in terms of profit (which is an unreliable proxy for what follows), utility, or in terms of some aesthetic/symbolic function (like the Great Pyramids, for example). It is interesting to note that only a small percentage of scientific research yields immediately tangible results with clearly developed applications. This is typically corporate sponsored R&D endeavored with the specific intent develop solutions and products for distribution and market consumption. The remaining academic research (think hard sciences like the Large Hadron Collider) typically takes decades before the utility of the observations can be used in some social setting.
